column4: Can anyone help a newbie set up Ubuntu to connect to the Internet?
I just installed Ubuntu but for some reason it's not detecting my Internet.  Any thoughts?
Cables are plugged -seems like Ubuntu detects my ethernet card, but it seems like I'm missing something here...
Are you using a router?  Do other machines work on this network?
do you think my disconnect has to do with my Linksys router?
If your other machine is working fine, then probably not.  I was just asking to get more details.
Try opening up a terminal on the machine that doesn't work and write ping "google.com" and let me know what you get back
OK, just a sec...
ping: unknown host google.com
Hrm.  What makes you think that Ubuntu detects your ethernet card?
went to System>Administration>Hardware Drivers
What happens when you click on NetworkManager?
it says no networks available
What happens when you type "ifconfig" into the terminal?
Post the output into past.ubuntu.com
lo  Link encap:  Local Loopback
No problem.
Also, if we are unable to help you here today, try your luck on the Ubuntu forums
thank you.  Everyone has been so very helpful to this newbie.
Hey, no problem.
Hrm.  I'm really stumped.  I would definitely recommend the Ubuntu Forums.
